intro: Cipura xanthomelas subsp. flavescens, commonly known as the yellow-flowered cipura, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of yellow flowers with five petals, which bloom in the spring. Its fruits are small, capsule-like structures that contain several seeds. This subspecies is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded, moist environments.
